Now in Unity you have two render
pipelines. You have the scriptable
render pipeline. One is the HDRP which
is the high definitionition render
pipeline and then URP which is the
universal render pipeline. And both
they're very good. Uh the downside of
that is if you're making a PC console
game and you chose HDRP
then if you want to convert that game to
a mobile game it's hard to say the
least. Uh you you can't switch from HDRP
to URP easily at the very least. Uh and
that's not really ideal. And in Unreal
Engine, that's not a problem because in
Unreal Engine, we have something called
the unified render pipeline. And it's
the same pipeline that exists between a
mobile game, a PC game, console game, a
Switch game, any kind of game. So
remember the the quadrant I talked about
earlier where you shouldn't be branching
to do your game development. This is

information regarding your actor within
the scene itself. So it contains
information or it stores information
like its location, rotations, transform
information and all of the all of those
kind of things. Now when you enable GPU
scene or you enable uh auto instancing

you to do is it merges all of these
actors into a single into a sing or as
as low as possible in fact or single
draw calls which means your performance
on your mobile device just increases
